events.title: Battle of Pavia
events.description: The Battle of Pavia took place during the Italian Wars, where Imperial forces led by Charles V defeated the French army, capturing King Francis I of France.
events.significance: This battle marked a decisive shift in power in Italy and solidified Habsburg dominance in Europe.

events.title: Pope Gregory XIII Announces the Gregorian Calendar
events.description: Pope Gregory XIII issued a papal bull that introduced the Gregorian calendar, reforming the Julian calendar to correct for inaccuracies in the calculation of leap years and the calendar year length.
events.significance: The Gregorian calendar became the internationally accepted civil calendar and remains in use today.

events.title: The Meiji Restoration Begins
events.description: Emperor Meiji was restored to power in Japan, ending the Tokugawa shogunate.
events.significance: This event marked the beginning of Japan's rapid modernization and westernization.

events.title: February Revolution Begins in Russia
events.description: Strikes and protests in Petrograd erupted, marking the beginning of the February Revolution which eventually led to the abdication of Tsar Nicholas II.
events.significance: This revolution led to the fall of the Russian monarchy and paved the way for the rise of the Soviet Union.

events.title: People Power Revolution in the Philippines
events.description: Ferdinand Marcos fled the Philippines after 20 years in power, ending his dictatorship and restoring democracy under Corazon Aquino.
events.significance: The revolution became a model for peaceful demonstrations effecting political change worldwide.
